title: Add optional "squared" argument to pairwise_distance
body_html: In many cases one only needs to use squared distances and can avoid taking the square roots (e.g. in k-means, nearest neighbors). This PR adds a boolean argument "squared" to pairwise_distance to be used only in combination with p = 2 if the user only needs to compute squared distances.
body_text: In many cases one only needs to use squared distances and can avoid taking the square roots (e.g. in k-means, nearest neighbors). This PR adds a boolean argument "squared" to pairwise_distance to be used only in combination with p = 2 if the user only needs to compute squared distances.
body: In many cases one only needs to use squared distances and can avoid taking the square roots (e.g. in k-means, nearest neighbors). This PR adds a boolean argument "squared" to `pairwise_distance` to be used only in combination with `p` = 2 if the user only needs to compute squared distances.
